courseDetails.title: Disruptive Thinking
courseDetails.shortDescription: Challenge norms, Foster collaboration, and apply Disruptive Strategies across Industries
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Disruptive Thinking by MTF Institute

In rapidly evolving world, the ability to think differently isn't just an advantage—it's essential. This comprehensive course, offered by the MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance, will equip you with the foundational principles and practical techniques to challenge conventional wisdom, spot hidden opportunities, and drive meaningful innovation across any industry.


Led by the Dr. Alex Amoroso, a seasoned expert in research methodologies, strategy, and product development, this course dives deep into:

  • Understanding the core principles of disruptive thinking and how it differs from traditional approaches.

  • Recognizing and challenging ingrained thinking patterns and overcoming cognitive biases.

  • Harnessing the power of collaboration to fuel innovative solutions.

  • Applying disruptive thinking strategies to specific industries like Business & Administration, Science & Technology, and Banking & Finance.

  • Cultivating a disruptive mindset and developing a personal action plan for your career.


Whether you're an entrepreneur, a business leader, or an individual looking to make a greater impact, this course will empower you to become a catalyst for innovation.

Ready to unlock your potential to become a true disruptive thinker?


This course should offer a comprehensive exploration of disruptive thinking, emphasising its importance in a rapidly changing world. It guides learners through recognising and challenging traditional thinking patterns, fostering a growth mindset, encouraging creativity and innovation, addressing cognitive biases, embracing ambiguity, and using effective collaboration to drive disruptive thinking. It also covers user-centric approaches, prototyping, iteration, trend analysis, communication, case studies, personal action plans, and strategies for overcoming challenges, ensuring a deep understanding and practical application of disruptive thinking principles.

Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 216 countries and has been chosen by more than 750 000 students.


Course Author:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. With a Doctorate Degree from the School of Social Sciences and Politics in Lisbon, Portugal, where she was awarded distinction and honour for her exemplary research, Alex Amoroso brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table.

In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses on to wide range of students from undergraduate level to business students of professional and executives courses. Currently, at EIMT in Zurich, Switzerland, she lectures for doctoral students, offering advanced instruction in research design and methodologies, and in MTF Institute Ms. Amoroso is leading Product Development academical domain.

In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. She implemented the best market practices in industries from Banking and Finance, to PropTech, Consulting and Research, and Innovative Startups.

Alex Amoroso's extensive scientific production includes numerous published articles in reputable journals, as well as oral presentations and posters at international conferences. Her research findings have been presented at esteemed institutions such as the School of Political and Social Sciences and the Stressed Out Conference at UCL, among others.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


The ability to think disruptively is no longer a luxury, it's a necessity. This comprehensive course, Disruptive Thinking equips you with the foundational principles and practical techniques to challenge conventional wisdom, identify hidden opportunities, and drive meaningful innovation in any field.

We begin by dissecting the very essence of disruptive thinking, contrasting it with traditional, incremental approaches. Through real-world examples spanning diverse sectors, you'll grasp the profound impact of disruptive innovations and understand the forces shaping our future. You'll learn to recognize the cognitive biases and mental models that often trap us in outdated ways of thinking and discover strategies to break free from these limitations.

The core of this course lies in mastering the fundamental principles of disruptive thinking. We'll delve into the art of questioning assumptions, embracing the discomfort of ambiguity, and adopting a first-principles mindset. You'll learn to focus on unmet needs and underserved markets – the fertile ground where true disruption often takes root.

Building a disruptive mindset is paramount. This course provides practical exercises and reflection prompts to cultivate your curiosity, foster resilience in the face of setbacks, and nurture a growth-oriented perspective. You'll develop the mental agility required to not only generate novel ideas but also to navigate the uncertainties inherent in the innovation process.

Moving beyond individual mindsets, we explore the power of collaboration in driving disruption. You'll learn how to build diverse teams, leverage cross-functional expertise, and employ effective brainstorming and idea generation techniques. We'll immerse ourselves in collaborative problem-solving methodologies like Design Thinking and Agile, equipping you with the tools to translate innovative ideas into tangible solutions.

Furthermore, you'll discover how to build and leverage collaborative networks, connect with external stakeholders, and tap into the power of open innovation and crowdsourcing. We'll also address the critical aspects of leading collaborative disruption, fostering a culture of innovation, managing conflict, and overcoming resistance to change.

Finally, we'll apply the principles of disruptive thinking to specific industries, including Business & Administration, Science & Technology, and Banking & Finance. Through insightful case studies, you'll witness how disruptive strategies are transforming these sectors and identify potential avenues for future innovation. The course culminates in a focus on personal disruption, empowering you to identify your own blind spots, develop a personal innovation plan, and build a supportive network to propel your career forward.

By the end of this course, you will not only understand the theory behind disruptive thinking but also possess the practical skills and mindset to become a catalyst for innovation and drive meaningful change in your personal and professional life. Join us on this transformative journey and unlock your potential to become a true disruptive thinker.
targetAudiences: This course is for professionals, entrepreneurs, leaders, and anyone interested in fostering innovation, challenging conventional approaches, and driving meaningful change in their field or career.

courseDetails.title: Bank Reconciliation: From Fundamentals to Advanced Technique
courseDetails.shortDescription: Lear how to prepare bank reconciliation statement and account reconciliation
courseDetails.longDescription:
Maintaining accurate financial records is essential for any business, and bank reconciliation is a critical process that ensures your cash records match your bank statements. However, discrepancies like missing transactions, bank errors, and timing differences can make reconciliation frustrating and time-consuming. This course provides a clear, step-by-step approach to mastering bank reconciliation, from identifying discrepancies to posting accurate adjusting entries.

Key Learning Objectives:

  • Understand the fundamentals of bank reconciliation, including key terms such as outstanding checks, deposits in transit, and bank errors.

  • Identify and resolve discrepancies by analyzing differences between your records and bank statements.

  • Record adjusting journal entries to correct errors and ensure your books are accurate.

  • Apply best practices to streamline the reconciliation process and prevent future mistakes.

  • Gain hands-on experience through practical exercises using real-world examples and templates.

Who Should Take This Course?

  • Accounting and finance students looking to strengthen their practical skills.

  • Bookkeepers and accountants who want to improve accuracy and efficiency in reconciliations.

  • Small business owners and entrepreneurs managing their own finances.

  • Aspiring accounting professionals preparing for careers in auditing, financial analysis, or CPA certification.

Course Benefits:

This course cuts through the complexity and provides straightforward, actionable training. You’ll learn how to confidently reconcile accounts, troubleshoot errors, and maintain flawless financial records. Whether you're a beginner or need a refresher, this course equips you with the skills to handle bank reconciliations with ease.
targetAudiences: Accounting & Finance Students – Build a strong foundation in bank reconciliation and adjusting entries.  Bookkeepers & Accountants – Sharpen your skills in detecting errors, posting adjustments, and ensuring accurate financial records.  Small Business Owners – Learn to reconcile your own bank statements and correct discrepancies confidently.
